Used in character summoning.

A rare Dalpobeast. Used to get 4x stage drops.

A moment seized in a picture, a fragment of a time gone by, a precious souvenir. This is a token of friendship in memory of the adventures you shared together.
Use it as your portrait in your profile.
Low frequency polarization. Scattered polarization which is not enough to form images. A <nobr>low-level</nobr> material used for ascending a Psychube's level limit.

The high priest who symbolizes harvest. Used to level up all parts of the Paleohall.

A mysterious box. Open it to get the following <nobr>high-level</nobr> materials used for Insight or Resonate.
Use to unlock higher decibel level in Roar Jukebox.
A medication used for interrogations. It can be turned in as a task item in story trails.
A key for a door waiting to be opened. It can be turned in as a task item in story trails.
A restaurant leaflet. It can be turned in as a task item in story trails.
A key to the gate entwined by thorns. It can be turned in as a task item in story trails.

A toy used to awaken the blurred memory about a puppy. It can be turned in as a task item in story trails.

We all yearn for wealth and satisfaction. Use to get a modest amount of Sharpodonty.
We all yearn for wealth and satisfaction. Use to get a large pile of Sharpodonty.
A capsule derived from a <nobr>well-proven</nobr> experiment result. Contains a small amount of Dust to level up characters.
Stable encapsulated gel made with the latest formula. Contains a modest amount of Dust for leveling up rituals.
A box of capsules made with a special recipe. Contains a generous serving of Dust to level up characters.
A popular confection in the world of arcanists. Restores 60 Cellular Activity.
Now packed with more active ingredients and fewer additives. Restores 120 Cellular Activity.
A priceless arcanum currency. Can be used for summoning and item purchases.
A priceless arcanum currency. Can be used for summoning or restoring Cellular Activity.
An acceptable currency amongst the arcanists. Everyone needs some of this.
A cell colony unique to the arcanists. The cell activity supports the application of common arcanist skills.
Echoes of the ultra law. Can be used for leveling up characters.
A track that has gone lost. Can be exchanged for items at the [Bass Counter] in the Bank.
An album of tracks that have gone lost. Can be exchanged for items at the [Treble Counter] in the Bank.
An element of arcanist's thoughts. Can be exchanged for items at the [Psychube Shop] in the Bank.
A complete arcanist's thoughts. Can be exchanged for items at the [Psychube Shop] in the Bank.

Chat in front of the Bar
A mysterious watchmaker wearing a strange hat.
A lady with a magic crescent staff. Everywhere she goes, a huge wave of trees and vines come roaring over.
To her, capturing you is as easy as cutting off an eagle's wings in the air.
She is here with poems, not to recite them, but to discipline the targets.
A Rock 'n' roll jockey! A Radio DJ! The great Captain Regulus is here! She's always carefree and never fears the crashing waves. All the stars have their eyes on you, so don't be shy! Let's rock!
Don't be frightened. She's just a little rockin' pirate.

The most knowledgeable and modest fruit in the world.
It's beautiful and fragrant. It is Rockin' girl's friend in red.
This little apple has great wisdom. He is the most loyal mate of the rockin' pirate.
Manus Vindictae's companion. Watch out for her guns. You've already learned how powerful they are.
A girl in a frilly rose skirt. There are no flames in her gun. Instead, she strikes the enemy in the soul.
Manus Vindictae's loyal follower. A regular at masquerade balls, she is always the center of attention.
Manus Vindictae's loyal follower. His body was merged with a gigantic snare drum. He lost the ability to speak but in exchange, obtained brute strength.
Manus Vindictae's loyal follower. His body was merged with a gigantic triangle. He lost the ability to speak but in exchange, obtained uncanny strength.
A creation of Manus Vindictae. No soul resides in this empty body. Created on a whim by someone capable in the Manus, they keep swarming out like the ants in the ground.
A creation of Manus Vindictae. No soul resides in this empty body. An imitator whose behaviors are like the so-called art that draws on children's crayon drawings with propylene.
Manus Vindictae's loyal follower. He is a bodyguard, a butler and also a decent howling gentleman.
Manus Vindictae's loyal follower. Don't refuse a warm invitation. The dance floor is packed and she most certainly can "hit" it off with the arcanists.
Manus Vindictae's loyal follower. Even with this strange mask and the mournful wails around him, he is still an outstanding cellist.
Manus Vindictae's loyal follower. She is polite, well-behaved and very reliable. She can handle everything in neat and proper ways, including enemy carcasses.
Manus Vindictae's loyal follower. He is gentle, polite and trustable. His sword will end all lives before they feel any pain.
Manus Vindictae's loyal follower. When the "Storm" comes, the followers of the Manus will have to face the truth that they are no longer themselves.
An illusion of a Manus believer. The Guiding One's clone or shard. Her most loyal puppet who lives and dies for her.
An unnamed person who desires the reformation of everything. 2 drops of snake venom, 1 spoon of silence, 3 grams of shame, 2 fingers of an unrepentant heart, 5 ounces of unforgettable yesterday.
The fragments of the Guiding One's truth are nothing else, but fragments. She can be seen, but cannot be forecast. She is like a flawless work of art, and a maniac who announces death.
A critter chasing after the Dust. This is its city. It is its right to wear anything it wants, even if it's a stinky... can?
A critter chasing after the Dust. My aunt's going to make a fuss if I keep this wild and unruly hairstyle!
A critter chasing after the Dust. This can bring a sense of security, such that it feels like a lady in a mink coat. Look at it! Adorable, isn't it?
The general's beloved furball. A pitiful little thing with separation anxiety which starts making a fuss the moment it doesn't see anyone around. To date, it has already torn through thirteen sofas.
A critter chasing after the Dust which often wears a skull. A gold bar? Delicious? *Crunch crunch* Ooh! Terrific!
Dryads which live by a tree's roots. Their lives are interconnected with the woods.
Dryads which live by a tree's roots. They are filled with hatred and murmur invitations to every passer-by. Come, come... come into the forest.
A critter chasing after the Dust which often wears stone fragments. A gold bar? Delicious? *Crunch crunch* Ooh! Terrific!
A critter chasing after the Dust whose shape is drawn with pastel. It has no real malice, just like a child tearing the wings off a butterfly to admire its beauty.
A group of critters enjoying the Dust which are gluttonous and play cute a lot. They are insatiable and drink cactus juice until they are drunk.
The general's beloved spikeball. Spikey knows you've been having a hard time, so it wants you to sleep so well that you never have to wake up again. Come on, thank me.
Plant Afflatus critters proficient at physical attacks. As they reside long-term in Plant Afflatus spaces, their bodies have been altered.
Plant Afflatus critters proficient at arcane attacks. As they reside long-term in Plant Afflatus spaces, their bodies have been altered.
Beast Afflatus critters proficient at physical attacks. As they reside long-term in Beast Afflatus spaces, their bodies have been altered.
Beast Afflatus critters proficient at arcane attacks. As they reside long-term in Beast Afflatus spaces, their bodies have been altered.
Mineral Afflatus critters proficient at physical attacks. As they reside long-term in Mineral Afflatus spaces, their bodies have been altered.
Mineral Afflatus critters proficient at arcane attacks. As they reside long-term in Mineral Afflatus spaces, their bodies have been altered.
Star Afflatus critters proficient at physical attacks. As they reside long-term in Star Afflatus spaces, their bodies have been altered.
Star Afflatus critters proficient at arcane attacks. As they reside long-term in Star Afflatus spaces, their bodies have been altered.
An obstacle that is doomed to appear while pursuing willpower. It represents an emotion which is likely to be the terror and anxiety you have felt.
An obstacle that is doomed to appear while pursuing willpower. It represents an emotion which is likely to be the frustration and resentment you have felt.
An egg-like creature born from the scale flame of the Jersey Devil. It burns all the ashes on its way and feeds on chaos.
An egg-like creature born from the scale flame of the Jersey Devil. It absorbs all the skeletons on its way and feeds on fear.
Born by the scales dropped from the Mothman's wings, it is the embodiment of the devilish. Whoever touches it will suffer misfortune in the future and lose part of their health and wealth.
Born by the scales dropped from the Mothman's wings, it is the embodiment of the demonic. Whoever touches it will suffer misfortune in the future and lose part of their peace and freedom.
A group of rats tangled together. They once went through the sewers, passed by the tombs. They deserve a medal for having disabled everyone's nose.

A group of rats tangled together, or something else. Tangling tails should be the major of the wanderers in the dark, but there are always exceptions, and they have nothing to do with how much one has learned.

A critter whose visual organ has degenerated,  usually lives in shadows. With a slender body and a bright-colored comb, it is active mostly during the day. It's recommended to check it over 3-5 times before keeping it as a pet.

With an aggressive appearance, this flying critter actually has a peaceful character. Since they could not leave home, what the Manus offers is indeed a great temptation to them. Now they are free to go to the next cage.

A puppet of the Yateveo, with a honeycomb as its head and holes as its eyes. It was a lynx in the previous life and is a hound in the current one. As a prisoner, it can hunt down the Yateveo's target.

A puppet of the Yateveo, with a honeycomb as its head and holes as its eyes. It was a lynx in the previous life and is an eagle in the current one. As a prisoner, it can hunt down the Yateveo's target.

A furry moth. The nightmare of plants, cleaners and doctors.
There are no contingency treatment for them, but take it easy. The nurses are skilled in this.

A furry moth. The nightmare of plants, cleaners and doctors.
The textbook has no details about it. Obviously, There should be a name of the brave.
A group of critters enjoying the Dust. Good friend, good friend, yum, yum, yum! Good friend! Yum! Yum, yum! Good friend! Yum!
A group of critters enjoying the Dust. None of them is literate, but the one holding the newspaper always looks smarter.
A group of critters enjoying the Dust. Some critters pick up wire mesh while others burrow into paper boxes. Their personalities appear to be very distinct.
A rabbit-type critter with huge antlers. The earliest recorded sighting dates back to the Halloween of 1829. It was the craziest Halloween of the 80s and we all remember it.
A group of critters enjoying the Dust whose shape is drawn with pastel. They look like a pile of oranges, only without vitamin C.
Plant Afflatus critters. Monstrous wolves tangled together. The moss on their bodies always makes them itch terribly.
Beast Afflatus critters. Monstrous wolves tangled together. Due to arcane skills, their spines have grown abnormally long.
Mineral Afflatus critters. Monstrous wolves tangled together. Their limbs, which are attached to heavy rocks, can easily tear preys apart.
Star Afflatus critters. Monstrous wolves tangled together. When they start running, the stars on their bellies collide and ring clearly.
The foundation builder among the Shamirs, the "Creature of Wonder." Of course Cimo Chase doesn't work on these complacent friends at all, their background is much more noble than normal bugs.
The engraver among the Shamirs, the "Creature of Wonder." Their ancestors might have contributed to the construction of the Temple in Jerusalem, so please forgive them for their occasional arrogance.
A master of the critters devouring the Dust. I never expected this little thing around. This is too strange, seriously!!!
A master of the critters devouring the Dust. A little thing which is very vain. It believes it looks like a queen when it drapes cardboard over itself.
A master of the critters devouring the Dust. It is so big that the carton cannot contain it. It still enjoys the feeling of being embraced though.

A mysterious creature with feathered wings, a fifth limb and looks like a bobcat. The person who gave it its name must have hoped it would turn out kind, friendly and beautiful. Unfortunately, the opposite was true.
Plant Afflatus critter. By the time people take notice of the odd floral scent, it will be far, far too late.
Beast Afflatus critter. She will embrace every child she acknowledges, including you and me.
Mineral Afflatus critter. Silent, stubborn, unwilling to yield, just like an unchanging mountain range.

Star Afflatus critter.
She greets every single person who comes here in a friendly manner, but that only makes her seem more dangerous.
A concept representing wild beasts. A concept that is larger than an emotion. It is usually found when you pursue willpower to the end in a bizarre manner.
A concept representing the forest. A concept that is larger than an emotion. It is usually found when you pursue willpower to the end in a bizarre manner.

A walking embodiment of misfortune from the irresistible, the devilish. It is unreasonable and unpredictable. Sometimes it forecasts the death of the living, and sometimes it bestows incomprehensible fortune upon mortals.

A walking embodiment of misfortune from the irresistible, the demonic. It is unreasonable and unpredictable. Sometimes it forecasts the death of the living, and sometimes it bestows incomprehensible fortune upon mortals.

The most primitive individual among the species, and the one that took the most time to tame. As soon as it cries in silence, its followers will gather. An epoch-making way to deliver newspaper! It may replace the newsboys.

An ancient tree that feeds on humans. There is a blurred face on its scorched slime.
When the flame burns to the ground, the hideous face will fade away in the ashes, putting an end to the sacrifice ritual at the price of grudge.

A sprite chasing after lights and fragrance. They are sly and agile. Defense is well-nigh impossible for them.
They will do anything to defend the spice box stolen from you.
A terrifying monster king. A dark and fathomless nightmare. Despite how tiny and cute it might seem, people should tremble in fear of it.
An experience that finally transcends authority. Is free will a lie? Is everything simply a happenstance? Gaze into its eyes and you'll find the answer.
A thug from the Rock City. A marksman? That's nothing.

A thug from the Rock City.
He has eagle's eyes, fox's movement, and lion's heart.
A thug from the Rock City. The dogs which don't bark bite the hardest.
A trusted aide of the Rock City. He always remembers to check if those lying on the ground are still breathing. The villains in this world should have learned this move ages ago.
A trusted aide of the Rock City. The room needs to be cleaned, so do the city and under that fancy seat of yours.
A trusted aide of the Rock City. The capable jabber away as much as they work.

A warrior of repute.
His name is sang in many places, his victories in the dueling ground are told by many.

An external affairs officer of the Shadow Sisters.
Always holding her chin high, she's sharp and mean. That evil and beautiful smile contains her overconfidence.

A member of the Shadow Sisters.
What I know, what I see, and what I hear are completely true.
A member of the Shadow Sisters. I'm just as deserving of things that are nice, luxurious and enviable. I deserve those gazes and praise.
Leader of the Shadow Sisters. I always want more when I have everything.

The gatekeeper of the Steel Brothers. He is silent, steadfast and disciplined. He never oversteps his boundaries and is always respectful, akin to a loyal dog. It is the only way for him to stay here.
A member of the Steel Brothers. Fights, prejudice, mayhem, conflicts, harsh words and physical violence. I am passionate about all of these.
A member of the Steel Brothers. I am not worried when I push a wall over, because I know that harsh words and a stinging cheek will result in it being rebuilt.
Leader of the Steel Brothers. All that differs from me shall fall because of me.

A patient whose mental status is not stable. 
The threat of a key can be even bigger than that of a knife. It is proven by Ivan who suffers from a delusional disorder.
Leader of the Rock City. The eldest of the triplets. Born with a flared nose, he has made every person who mocked him regret it.
Leader of the Rock City. The middle child among the triplets has a very short fuse. He is not hard to get along with unless you insult his brother.
Leader of the Rock City. The youngest of the triplets. Sickly as a child and even more slender than his younger sister, he is called the "Little Finger" by his family.
A renowned fighter. Many are unconscious even before they get a clear look at his face.
A popular pet lover who has a coat covered in cat hair. He isn't the person you know. He really isn't.
A drunk man singing brazenly. The pitch-black and bottomless abyss ahead isn't important. What's important is that we have some good alcohol here.

A blind follower of the Manus who hopes to escape the "Storm." 
The first time he picked up a knife was to protect the weak, but the same cannot be said for the second.

A blind follower of the Manus who hopes to escape the "Storm." 
That night, he lost his friends who refused to wear the mask and himself who wore the mask.

An unkempt tramp who is still afraid to admit to his mistakes. 
He still has an obsession with his past and has never considered putting his faded fire axe away.

A patient murmurs to himself.
The change of the world has taken him to insane. The process is unbearably long, painful and irreversible.

A mankind fighter who advocates and yearns for violence. 
Rewards? Reputation? Cheers? What do they have to do with me? I just want to break their noses!

A mankind fighter who advocates and yearns for violence. 
Opponents tremble in fear at the very sight of his massive physique. He is both proud and upset about this.

A kid filled with malicious intent who is always rude towards strangers. 
He used to be an ignorant kid living an uneventful childhood, but the madness of 1929 came and he, too, suffered.

A violent kid who is proud of his height.
He was what the neighbors on Avenue 3 called a good kid, up till he grew taller and realized brute force could solve everything.

A guard of the Foundation's visitor's area. A dedicated in-staff member.
He didn't have the chance to be the guard of significant guests though he was one of the top students back in school. But he still believes that he will be assigned greater missions.

A guard of the Foundation's visitor's area. A dedicated in-staff member.
He has escorted many guests for the Foundation but still no chance to get promoted. Which mission could possibly go wrong?

A normal and dedicated in-staff member of the Foundation.
He thinks nothing could be more serious than a shredder violent. Unlike bubbles which break and leave no sign behind, shreds has a longer and more obvious existence.

A normal and dedicated in-staff member of the Foundation.
He suggests not take any chances and considers child locks are necessary for shredders. Of course he said that AFTER that incident.

A security guard of SPDM, equipped with even better gears. 
He is a remarkable guard good at using all kinds of guard weapons. His performance has been outstanding, at least in trainings.

A security guard of SPDM, and a loyal regular employee.
He thought the baton distributed to him should be used to protect the students. Fortunately that idea has been corrected in no time.

A security guard of SPDM, equipped with even better gears. 
He believes his propensity for violence comes from his noisy siblings, but not his instinct.

A security guard of SPDM and a loyal employee. 
He has enough strength to hold the biggest shield, but can't even solve the simplest math problem, which is, however, a good news for his supervisor.

A patrol guard of the Foundation. A skillful in-staff member.
His mother must have many wishes about his bright future. It's certainly just a wish.

A patrol guard of the Foundation. A skillful in-staff member.
He well plans how to step into the door everyday. Left foot on even dates and right foot on odd dates. He will follow this pattern until he dies.

A Foundation guard equipped with better weapons.
He was born a left-hander. It took a lot of practicing alone to match other's behavior.

A Foundation guard equipped with better weapons.
His aim is so poor that even a tramp is richer than that. Luckily, a taser will function perfectly even without a good aim.

The leader of the Foundation guards with Artificial Somnambulism weapons.
The Employee Manual Ver.Ⅶ is carefully hidden in the pocket at inner thigh part of the pants. Though it disturbs the action but somehow makes him feel safe.
A student of SPDM. He is proud of his performance at school, but also feels self-abased for being a plain civilian.

A student of SPDM. 
Compared to exams, she is better at forming cliques and pulling pranks.

A student of SPDM. 
He has always believed that he deserves the most attention, but it takes time to release his real potential.

A student of SPDM. Jill is often considered a good student. 
This misunderstanding has brought much convenience to her life.
A heat-resistant tinfoil garbage bag used by the rehabilitation center. A garbage bag with self-awareness is not that rare. What's more intriguing is how it ties itself.

An intern of Zeno's air force, and a conceited pilot.
She "takes credit" for the wordy Flying Manuals of Zeno. The latest version includes "Bottled liquid prohibited," "Frequent barrel roll at low altitude prohibited," etc.
This is the best toy for her. "Looks like there is something to be said for those old fogeys of the Foundation!" You don't hear that every day.
An iron ring floating in the air. It is good at changing direction and passing over things at random. Many arcanists who love physics are crazy about it and have spent their whole life on its study.
An iron ring floating in the air. It is good at staying still and making movement at random. Hmm ... Amazing arcanum.

The embodiment of the Foundation's core mind, materialized in the form of gilded marble.
Solid, loyal and tidy.
The Goddess of Fortune is on my side!
He is thinking about the most complicated thing in the world.
Here's his strategy: to fight the unpredictable fate, be more unpredictable.
Look at this poor guy. He's fooled by luck again.

A guard of the amusement park's.
He says no to anything uncertain.

A guard of the amusement park's.
He is good at memory games.

A guard of the amusement park's.
He is in charge of the maintenance and management of all balloons.

A guard of the amusement park's.
He's always looking forward to the next promotion ... Yes, "the next promotion."
Friends cheer for the long-anticipated picnic.
Friends put on new clothes for the long-anticipated picnic.
Friends gather here for the long-anticipated picnic.
It's not hungry, but never stops staring at the prey in peer's mouth ...
It comes after the shadow, aiming at your ankle and neck ...
Snarling and drooling, it has no intension to hide its desire ...
No matter you want it or not, she listens to everything you say. All of your cowardice and pride will hide nowhere and go into her ears.
He always has a new experiment to do, and it is usually dangerous and unpredictable. You'd better stay away if you don't want to be the next subject.
She holds her head high. It seems the garbage bag blocking her sight can't stop her onward marching. Instead, it makes her look ... mysterious.
An "elf" who has no patience and enjoys being alone. Many who have been fooled would have sent a complaint letter if she had a mailbox.
When he approaches you alone, it means both of you are surrounded by the silent wolves.
Riding the waves on the duck boat, the viking starts her expedition.
The experience passed down generation by generation will teach her to put on the cloak and grab the axe.
A good journalist is already at the scene before the incident happens. Have faith in her, and her extraordinary instinct.
A white sheet drenched in salty, bitter sea water, under which is a ghost floating in the air, waiting for a playmate.
A body guard of the Sotheby's. Fred is strong and confident enough, but he can use a bit more luck. Rewards? Reputation? Cheers? What do they have to do with me? I just want to break their noses!
A mankind challenger who advocates and yearns for violence. Opponents tremble in fear at the very sight of his massive physique. Danny is both proud and upset about this.
A patient and careful teacher. The way she wipes china is as gentle as that she strokes a child's hair.

Her hands are handcuffed,
But she can still serve food and roll the number you want.
Please stay behind the yellow line. You don't want to break the rules.
Take it easy. Everyone will get a balloon from the long-eared girl.
The king sees the big picture even offstage. I never expected this little thing around. This is too strange, seriously!!!
The offers are always made at the right time. That's why people often walk into the trap.
She's a train off the track which destroys the stage in the deafening applause. Who hears the sound of a gold coin dropping to the ground?
It has raced a car, but failed miserably ... What happened after that? You can check what's under it feet.
Under the moonlight, under the shady trees, the owner of the woods returns with vines.
Everything in his mind converts into melody through pressing the keys. Who says music can't speak?

The illusion created by the Artificial Somnambulism machine.
The hand can lift things up, and also throw things down.

The illusion created by the Artificial Somnambulism machine.
The hand can destroy one's will, and also scoop a handful of sand.

The illusion created by the Artificial Somnambulism machine.
The illusion strikes the reality, thus the spring breaks. Before the hand stops, everything here will be eroded.

The illusion created by the Artificial Somnambulism machine.
The creation imitates its creator. It won't wake up, neither will the the will of this place.
A federal agent who detests arcanum and hates the arcanists.
A box filled with supplies. What will happen if it's broken?
A box filled with potions. What will happen if it's broken?
A box filled with medical supplies. What will happen if it's broken?

A creation of Manus Vindictae. No soul resides in this empty body.
That mysterious eyeball sees through everything, including death and betrayal. It is the most loyal servant of the Guiding One.

A finely polished wooden racket with a familiar hat on it.
The style of its classic design fits the Foundation's vibe well, but somehow you can see a tone of "toppling" and "古灵精怪“
A box full of boost potion bottles. Break it and what will happen?
A box full of anesthetic bottles. Break it and what will happen?
A special device installed in the tunnel by the Foundation. Archaeologists attempted to study its pattern, but they passed out the next second. Honestly, it's not out of excitement.
A special device installed in the tunnel by the Foundation. This is a magnificent artwork, not just for a master potter, of course.
The trianglist who knocks their swollen shell and unties the souls.
The moss on their bodies always makes them itch terribly.
The bone spurs on their spine have made their life difficult; they always get stuck by stones or roots in the soil when taking a roll on the ground.
Their limbs, which are attached to heavy rocks and can easily tear prey apart.
When they start running, the stars on their bellies collide and ring brightly.
Little creatures mostly inhabiting the bushes.
Little creatures mostly living among the beasts.
Little creatures mostly seen in the depth of mines.
Little creatures mostly found on the mossy ground.
A mankind challenger who advocates and yearns for violence. Rewards? Reputation? Cheers? What do they have to do with me? I just want to break their noses!
A mankind challenger who advocates and yearns for violence. Opponents tremble in fear at the very sight of his massive physique. Danny is both proud and upset about this.
A blind follower of the Manus who hopes to escape the "Storm." Aaron was a kid on the streets. The first time he picked up a knife was to protect the weak, but the same cannot be said for the second.
A blind follower of the Manus who hopes to escape the "Storm." That night, Henry, who wore the mask, lost his friends who refused to wear the mask and himself.
An unkempt tramp who is still afraid to admit to his mistakes. Will still has an obsession with his past and has never considered putting his faded fire axe away.

A patient from the relief center who has gone insane from the turmoils around him. Ethan was eating "wheat bread" as usual, and half an hour later was admitted to the rescue center for gastroenteritis.
One of Arcana's most invincible creation
Star Afflatus critter. A woman who is dripping wet. She greets every single person who comes here in a friendly manner, but that only makes her seem more dangerous.

It may be the start or the end. Its possibilities are decided by your imagination.
No single musician can take credit for the success of an orchestra.

The snake is hissing to find its way.
It is now clear where to go and what to bite. It opens its mouth, it protrudes its fangs, it sinks them into the prey.
It cannot be accomplished in one night. Everything that you are about to experience will give you the strength to go forth.

Adjusts the angle, tightens the ribbon, and smooths the wrinkles.
Rolls the cuffs without drawing attention, unrolls them, and rolls them again.
She looks at herself in the mirror,
And the gentle good night.
I am ready to offer everything I have, for the new world and its <nobr>well-being</nobr>.

"I am first! I always am!"
The little winner jumped into the house of gray and white marble.
The third place?
NO! NO! NO!
That brush of orange jumped out of the chalk box, and even out of the house.
"Where is she going this time?" Murmured the little winner, "Will I ever see her again?"

Carve and polish. Water, oil, honey and sand pile.
The moonlight witnesses the transformation of the old branch and the birth of the new wand.
The branch is reborn by the craftsman.
The craftsman is reborn by the future.
Identity means nothing to the forest.

The night will blaspheme against the light,
As well as the beauty, the happiness,
The peace, the slumber,
And every lullaby in her heart.
Since then, in the future of the future,
There will be no more peace in the long night.

Through the wind and the rain, her voice grows louder and louder,
Echoing within the limited space.
Further, higher, it never ceases to spread, NEVER.
Owning the audience and the theater, the queen remains on the stage,
Still seeing herself as the lord of the infinite universe.

Paths are made by walking.
Wine and bread are achieved by working.
The new sprout stretches its leaves,
Fighting sleepiness among the mountain of potions.
More time, she needs more time,
To read the next page of the book.

Wait, dodge, escape?
Sense of security, side of caution?
No.
Record, record, and record.
Record this very moment.
Yes.

On the sleepless nights,
On the painful mornings,
On the long afternoons with no one to talk to,
She opens one book after another.

When lifting the fog from the city, be careful,
Don't disturb the people hurrying home.
He travels through the city in alleys and arrives in time.
His duty will catch up with him, just as always.

The golden wattle drops to the ground. She sharpens it, polishes it till it is matte.
Half of it turns into the handy bow and arrows,
The other half turns into the streamlined surfboard.
"The tree is free as long as you are free," says the ocean.

Sitting in the small cubicle,
She typed. 41, line break, 41.
It was quiet, tranquil, and stable, 
and in the world of numbers she was safely swaddled.

Your child has never been your child.
A smart guardian is good at finding quality time to spend alone in the afternoon.
When the red fruit is fast asleep,
Will the gentleman fall from the tree?

The light is shining ahead.
It makes whatever is white whiter and whatever is shiny shinier.
Expectation, curiosity, desire, they are what the world is made of.
What I know about it is not the complete picture.

Do poems belong to parchment?
Do poems belong to walnut shell and ink?
Do poems belong to the nobles and the king?
No, said the snowy night, poems just belong to themselves.

Look around.
The edge of the stage is so far, far away.
It is beyond the islands, beyond the sea, beyond the ban and the fear.
Laugh, laugh away! There is no ending to the play!

The sailor embeds the cracks into his eyes, savoring the <nobr>bone-burning</nobr> pain.
With paeans and bleeding offered by the burning, the navigator floats high in the mist to burn down the wrong paths in the way.

Resonant and vigorous, its sound can awaken and guide the lost.
It will cleanse the people's chests when necessary.

A flash destined to disappear into craze.
The coin of greed has been tossed; it witnesses the beginning and the end of a moment.

The dark night peeks through itself, leading to a secret delight.
Along with scream and whine, the familiar death arrives as it has foretold, bringing a swamp of corpses.

The owner of those eyes which can see through everything keeps running towards the fireless night on and on.
The silent guiding horse, the Quiet Ravenheart.

Soft as breathing, itchy as allergy and hysteria.
Rubbed, grinded, twisted, tangled, the long thread connects savage and contempt.

The beating, thirsty hope of life.
The itchy longing from the bottom of the heart, the immortal new life. It grows, and grows.

An unknown fruit, both sweet and sour.
It has never existed for real, yet people eat it to savor the taste of loss.

Memory wears out in the wandering life, gaining only obscure colors and shapes.
What is the figure of the shadow in the shadow? The close friend of the close friend's strolls over in the delightful music.

The tortoise walks into the flame without hesitation.
It is devoured, soothed and drowned. It doesn't know whether it is dead or alive, nor can it feel a thing.

Unable to build its own nest, the common cuckoo is remorseful and tired.
No one affirms or denies it is a fraud.

A critter chasing after the Dust which often wears a moss helmet. 
A gold bar? Delicious? *Crunch crunch* Ooh! Terrific!

A critter chasing after the Dust.
His smell is bad, while temper is even worse.

A security guard of the New Human Security Company.
The first choice for people with robophobia. Not brave nor smart, he still wins the trust of employers with his in-depth knowledge of Guidance on Security.

A starving tramp under the daylight.
A decent job, a happy family ... Through the floating bubbles, he has them back.

A delirious drunkard wandering around in broad daylight. 
He is so drunk that nothing can make him stop except bubbles.

A member of the Metropolitan Police. They maintain the order for a living and supporting their families.
As an old-fashioned person with a strong sense of justice, he became better and better at this job after given the baton and power.

A member of the Metropolitan Police. They maintain the order for a living and work hard to support their families.
Strictly following the rules and expecting for no change, using a shield against the villains is his only mercy.

The security robot of the New Human Company. Its low price has won it popularity among the civilians.
As the prototype of a landmark security robot, it has a monumental significance that other robots don't.

The purger robot of the New Human Company. It is destructive and only can be applied as the last resort.
Although the intruders run away, but the room gets mangled. You can see the fixing bill and compensation are in the way. It's undoubtedly a nightmare.

A meticulously formulated soap bubble.
The crowd is cheering, singing a happy song. What the bubble reflected are not real; but there's nothing wrong with being enchanted by their dreams, right?

The man in charge of the New Humans Company.
His obsession of robots are extremely strong. However, no one knows that comparing with these shiny and delicate man-made products, he has more faith in Guidance on Security in his hands.

The security robot of the New Human Company. Its low price has won it popularity among the civilians.
Like a hound scaring the enemy, its rate of success reaches 60%.  For those poor employers, it works better than sleeping pills.

The scout robot of the New Human Company.
Being obedient and mild, it seems easier to get along with than its radical siblings.

The special service robot of the New Human Company, able to take on complex security tasks for its high mobility.
Safe than any type! With titanium alloy bullet-proof shell and hidden coffee machine inside, it's your ideal employee in office, the best choice in your family!

The special service robot of the New Human Company, able to take on complex security tasks for its high mobility.
Stable, multifunctional and no accidents so far, it's definitely the only robot you need for security needs!

The secret weapon behind the New Human Company, never known by the public.
It has a keen judgment of human behavior. What moving in the dark corners at night is more challenging for him.

Some flyers for distribution.
They are the scraps and drafts of the final work, unattractive as the insect-eaten apple in the fruit basket, or the broken leaf in a leaf collection book.

The noisy audience who cares little about other people's feelings.
He sings in his seat, indulging himself in the revelry, moving every joint to dance to victory.

The troublemaking audience who tries to infuriate others and stir up conflicts.
He doesn't come here to watch a game; he is here for more chaotic things.

The crazy audience who is unbelievably egocentric.
There's nothing wrong about promoting one's artwork, and it's also understandable that some people just want to watch a game. The consequences could be dreadful if someone insists to make these two things happen at the same time.

A piece of work far ahead of its time.
A being who takes the muddy swamp as its body, and the flytraps its limbs.

A massive portable device.
They should have been seen in labs, or museums. Not here.

The Eagle has grown.
Is this how one can be approved by the Scouts?

Her hair is more expensive than gold, and her lip print can be exchanged for a bundle of cash.

Is not worth a gold coin, or a silver one, or even a glance.

A flying critter endemic to Green Lake.
Terrified of encroachment by outsiders, it does everything in its power to protect its habitat.

A creepy critter that skulks around in the shadows.
Watch your step at all times, and steer clear of dark spaces like caves or holes in trees.

A Lindwurm mutated by Green Lake.
Rather than pet its head, it would prefer that people reach into its gaping mouth.

A critter colony that delights in dust.
They compulsively collect branches and scrap metal.

A Critter Lord that feeds on dust.
Cavities, cavities, cavities. Rest assured, it really is trying to cut back on sweets.

A Critter Lord that feeds on dust.
It insists that it's a famous celebrity, so much so that it wraps itself in multiple layers whenever it goes out.

A mysterious creature resembling a lynx, apart from the wings and fifth limb sprouting from its body.
Everyone needs a kitty-cat, serial killers and devil worshippers are no exception.

A fairy that inhabits Green Lake.
Sweet and lithe, such a loyal, fertile friendship lies in the dirt beneath a snow white blanket of fungi.

The custodian of the cemetery.
A new button, a family affair, a lie. Ah, sweet retribution.

A ghost that roams the forest.
A silver ring, a bouquet, a vow. Ah, a gently swaying coffin.

A butcher that dwells in the cellar.
His father methodically taught him how to create specimens, later becoming the child's first work of art.

A large critter that's obsessed with dust.
Scholarly and erudite, no other critter cuts a smoother figure.

An ordinary tooth spirit affected by Green Lake.
Ah, this is very helpful. We'll certainly be able to settle the score now.

A tooth fairy noble affected by Green Lake.
Their tougher physiques feature a greater variety of hues. Have they bid farewell to the tragedy of freedom then?

A servant made of clay.
The Mud Man was brought to life with an incantation. He fulfilled his purpose adequately, right up until the moment he was discarded. Wrath, deceit, betrayal—he learned quite a bit from his master.

The inventor's daughter.
Always the belle of the ball, not even the Mud Man could take his eyes off her this time.

The Mud Man's master.
The soldier inadvertently crushed his own toes with his hefty shield. "Naming something makes you its owner." This is a common human misconception.

An innocent child.
Most people see the horror of the Mud Man—his contortion, hate, and rage. But she sees his heart—it's so close she can reach out and touch it.

A mad doctor who's mastered the art of hypnosis.
He's a doctor of psychology at times and a homicidal maniac at others. "People wear all sorts of hats to get through life." That's what he always tells his patients.

A psychiatric patient undergoing hypnosis treatment.
The doctor once demonstrated the wonders of hypnosis on his patient. The audience could ask the patient any question they liked, and the patient would answer—be they about worries, secrets, or, of course, even death.

A vicious rioter.
He often returns to the scene of the crime. Reliving the crimes against acquaintances is a hard habit to shake.

A spirit walking among the crowd.
His feet float above the ground—he never felt such ease when he was alive.

A spirit trying to draw attention to itself.
The furniture moves on its own, the faucet won't stop running, and the clock always chimes at the wrong time... This is obviously an instance of organized crime.

A bloodshot eye.
Crying out with all its might, this weary eye must be seeking its other half.

An arthropod that breeds in porous spaces.
That rustling coming from the doorway is the language of greed and demands. You'd best avoid digging any deeper—who knows how much darkness lurks beyond view.

A creature made from various parts stitched together.
Always feeling like it's missing something, it wantonly assimilates new parts. Just one more, and it will be complete... No, another one...

A merciless, bloodthirsty monster.
They tend to be humane hunters, patient blacksmiths, or friendly neighbors. On the whole, they treat others with kindness—except when there's a full moon.

A pack of beasts that howl at night.
This is their most fervent and heartfelt salute to their returning king—it's also the horn signaling the start of their next hunt.

Armor that's been abandoned.
Over time, his former master grew senile and frail, ultimately discarding him here. Apparently, he doesn't believe this was a mistake.

A pair of innocent twin sisters.
They always appear together, hands and hearts linked. Feeling sleepy? Careful, that's their forte.

The most common object found in every household.
He basically poses no threat, just watch out for reflections that shouldn't be there.

A gift from the twins.
"Come play with us! " They're dying to make a new friend, so much so that she spoke without even being connected to a power source.

A fledging exorcist.
Too many voices, too many choices. He decided to renounce his thoughts and let the path he walks serve as his yardstick for justice.

A seasoned exorcist.
He can no longer tell whether the object of his slaughter is a man or a monster. In any case, he gets the job done quickly and effectively.

The DJ's robot attendant.
Apart from being responsible for "acoustics", it's also a qualified bodyguard.

A fearsome humanoid monster.
It would be difficult to call those limbs "well-proportioned" or that face "beautiful", but that grotesque and haunting appearance belies a kind heart. Prejudice is deadly—her fate is proof of that.

A machine pieced together from scrap parts.
The design inspirations of all manner of household appliances can be spotted in its form. Fortunately, it still works once powered up.

A mammal that sleeps upside down.
Slicing through their prey's skin with their teeth, the time has come to drink to their hearts' content.

A beautiful, long-lived creature.
They fear many things, including garlic, silver arrows, and sunlight. The only thing they don't fear is growing old.
Someone once told Bart that he wouldn't survive the streets empty-handed. Bart took this advice and ran with it—with a knife sharper than any other.

Meticulously mixed soap bubbles.
The butcher gets lost in thought gazing at the soap bubbles on occasion. For a moment, he saw himself as a youth—before he'd ever picked up a butcher's knife.
Among Marshal and his friends, each is as notorious as the next. Always taking to the streets together, they carve their names wherever they go.

When Jack returned, his <101:axe> let them know they had made a mistake. They begged for mercy, but it was too late. <104:The moonlight didn't shine that Friday. Misfortune had found a new home>.

Deformed bones pierce through flesh and skin, crying and <204:howling all the night long>, beneath the water's surface. 'Quiet!' came the angry shout from <202:the man holding the medicine box>.
The room was silent. <203:Some thing as white as snow> was <201:eating up all the candy>, whether inside the jar, outside the jar, black, or white.
The bride in her white dress wanders by the lake every night, <301:searching for her beloved>, searching for another happy bride...

"The gentle girl's tears stream down her face, the person in her heart concealing a sharp knife. A silver hoop made for a ring, a hemp rope made for a collar. <302:The sparkling light shines>, and she falls into the mirror."
<303:The elegy and the White Rose>—a wooden box buried six feet under, <301:the groom's> <304:ten fingers wring> tears from a white handkerchief. His beloved awakens in the dead of every night.
She visits him at night to fulfill the oath they made, taking his <304:eleven fingers> and carefully placing <303:rosebuds> between them...

<color=#B65223> [▩1%s] </color> Pick-up Banner has started. One random The Golden Thread (The Golden Thread I, The Golden Thread II, or The Golden Thread III) is guaranteed within 40 summons. Unravel The Golden Thread to select your 6 star character. 

This is a <color=#B65223> "special event" </color>, which follows different rules than other events. During the event, The Golden Thread rate up!

▪ In this banner, every 10 summons guarantees at least one 4-star or better character.
▪ Generally, the basic rate applies to all characters. Under certain circumstances, such as Rate Up or Guarantee, please refer to the specific rules.
▪ The Golden Thread will expire simultaneously with the event. Please select your 6 star character in the Golden Thread before the event ends.

When suspected of vandalizing public property and engaging in private fights with minor consequences and no severe damage caused, the Foundation imposes the following penalties:
<split>1. Issue an internal warning from the Foundation and a demotion.
2. Dismissal from Zeno Arms Academy.
3. Deduction from this quarter's salary and supply quota.
4. Compulsory participation in five Foundation operations as a special team member.

When suspected of using Arcane Skills to damage or occupy public places, causing serious losses, the following penalties are imposed:
<split>1. Elimination of the effects of the Arcane Skills and restoration to the original functionality of the site.
2. Mandatory participation in 120 hours of Foundation service activities.
3. Compensation of 200,000 Sharpodonty.

When suspected of assisting others in using Arcane Skills to vandalize and occupy public places, causing serious losses. Due to their good attitude in admitting fault and voluntarily offering financial compensation, a lenient punishment is imposed:
<split>1. Assist the culprit in eliminating the vegetation impact and restoring the original functionality of the site.
2. Compensate of 500,000 Sharpodonty.
Science is dead! It died on the last day of 1999!
Whoever dares to post such ridiculous flyers in Laplace again, I'll send them to the Food and Health Department to be experimental subjects for those freaks.

Adler, Senior Advisor in the Information Security Division of the Laplace Scientific Computing Center, will be dispatched to the Food and Health Department to participate in experiments.
Even if you used ROT13 encryption for your message, the outcome will be the same.

[A record of a meeting discussion from the Foundation's Chicago office report. The office is keenly endorsing an investigator named Hannah Geier.]

Maxim: What on earth is the Chicago office thinking? Recommending an investigator, who's barely had any experience in <nobr>large-scale</nobr> tasks and mostly teaches <nobr>potion-making</nobr> to Arcanists, to join the Foundation headquarters?

Katz: A typical political move, "promoting" an unwanted investigator to somewhere else.

Padre: I propose we just say no.

Z: Her resume is quite intriguing. I propose that the Investigations Department draft a detailed report to evaluate the possibility of bringing her back.

Maxim: You're kidding, right, Ms. Z?

???: Medicine Pocket? Chief, are you serious? How can such a greenhorn be appointed the head of the Biological Pharmaceuticals Department?

???: I never joke. Medicine Pocket has proven their capabilities in previous research and has shown that they are more than qualified for this position.

???: Do you have a problem with me, you stubborn old thing? Hah, could it be because your research over the last twenty years combined doesn't amount to what I've achieved in three?

???: Scientific research has nothing to do with age. Anyway, with the "Storm" now, we need more such talented researchers.

After a meeting discussion, the Foundation has officially named these two temporal disasters the "Storm".
Undoubtedly, the Laplace Scientific Computing Center is one of the institutes most severely affected by the "Storm".
Contact was lost with multiple research institutes, and over seventy scientists were sent back in time, including the previous and current chief officers and nearly half of the research department leaders.
Even now, many of these positions remain vacant.
The impact of the "Storm" on the Laplace Scientific Computing Center is not just material. Many of the surviving scientists have lost their faith in science and rationality, as well as their ability to conduct research.
In light of the foregoing, I have concluded that the Laplace Scientific Computing Center has completely lost its ability to perform its proper functions.

To Paulina:

    I have submitted your request for an external assignment to the <nobr>higher-ups</nobr>.

    The previous temporal disasters have caused irreversible damage to the Foundation, and your application for an external investigation at this time will weaken the Foundation's power, and the commissioner may reject your application as a result.

    Still, I must admit that your point of view is correct.

    You are not wrong. In a sense, the "Storm" is indeed an excellent opportunity. This era of regression allows us to evaluate the impact of the Foundation's Arcanist policies over the past decade in a more objective way.

    Therefore, I will offer as much support as I can. But we still know nothing about the temporal disasters; you are facing unknown dangers. Come back alive.


                                                              Juraj

A small setback on the path forward.

Laplace security personnel.
Better quality equipment doesn't seem to solve his troubles. He dreams of running into some imbeciles who can help him get a promotion, instead of sitting in the office all day accumulating nothing but seniority.

Laplace security personnel.
He claims to possess a wealth of "combat experience." For example, he can hold his breath for 180 seconds and find the emergency exit in the dark.

Senior Laplace security personnel.
One night, he intercepted a radio transmission and thwarted a potential incursion. From that moment on, his helmet became his most treasured possession, to the point where he refuses to take it off, even when sleeping.

A small flame in urgent need of attention.
It is no less important than the first spark ignited by a survivor. In some sense, they both symbolize hope.

Spathodea in a burning, chaotic state.
The little boxer needs a real sporting competition—an outlet to vent those flames that have nowhere else to go. Of course, we should try to find a way to calm the little boxer down before she burns out ...

A water beast of ancient Australian legend, said to feed on rumors.
A celebrity mired in controversy once hid in this alley and inadvertently raised a strange army of sewer soldiers.

A water beast of ancient Australian legend, said to feed on rumors.
This creature is adept at bogging you down in the mire of public opinion, oozing forth rumors until it has prepared a sumptuous feast.

This guardian of Uluru Stadium has upheld its duty for thousands of years.
The red land nurtures its hulking flesh and blood, and the long bone handle nurtures its sacred duties.

This guardian of Uluru Stadium has upheld its duty for thousands of years.
There it stood for eons, turning itself into a silent monolith until the door was reopened.

This giant thorny devil, born of the scorching earth, is endemic to Australia.
People mistakenly believe that its sluggishness is a result of too much sleep, but it actually awakened in a fit of rage—it just needs some time to understand exactly what is going on.

This giant thorny devil, born of the scorching earth, is endemic to Australia.
Ancient athletes customized special arcanum saddles for it, to prevent it from feeling dizzy and disoriented on long journeys, or from being injured by the weapons on its backs.

A small spark following the Uluru Flame.
This seemingly harmless little spark reminds people of one of those toy gun lighters children love to play with—hah! Try dealing with the searing pain of 2,000 ℃ and you'll know the true meaning of playing with fire!

Amidst a wave of high spirits, Ulu grows to a phenomenal size.
Athletes these days have no concept of this grand occasion. The last time she grew this big, she was sitting proud atop the high platform of the colorful lizard totem, watching the worshipers below striking stones and making fires.

Like all of Makower's journalists, he is more interested in headlines than the truth.
A hypocritical guide dog. A scandal-monger who could take any event out of context. He has a talent for turning any off-the-cuff remark you might make into front page news, ready for the morning paper.

The tail of a gigantic Bunyip, broken off from its body—the final destination of all suspicions, valid and invalid.
Malicious manipulation that extends its roots into the darkness, resulting in the manifestation of evil deeds from out of thin air.

The paw of a gigantic Bunyip, broken off from its body—the evolution of all false appearances.
The power of discourse wantonly redefines the boundary between black and white. As a result, the truth is despised and obfuscated.

The mouth of a gigantic Bunyip, broken off from its body—the source of all deceptive words.
Weak tyrants are adept at using the most frivolous words to brew the most catastrophic disasters.

Red tape related to the games' bidding process.
A menagerie of hundreds of mutually dependent and mutually negating entries. They leave you scratching your head until you finally realize they're all telling you the same thing—there's no way around this!

Red tape related to the games' bidding process.
Forms, forms, and more forms ... Damnit, if there were an opinion survey form among them, it'd be the most popular of the whole lot!

Red tape related to the games' bidding process.
Such meaningless standardized forms, but forms that need to be double-checked, nonetheless ... Their purpose is to prompt you to constantly make mistakes and then reduce the courtesies that follow, be they necessary or unnecessary.

A bodyguard hired by the newspaper for the frontline journalists.
At first, he didn't understand why the newspaper would splash out on his services. After witnessing their journalistic methods, he came to agree that it was indeed a high-risk profession.

A sprightly player. Perfect speed! Lightning reflexes!
That iconic jump—what a header! A great athlete who combines elegance with skill! *neighs*

A player who meticulously considers every detail in every game.
Believe in his judgment—in a sense, ball games, battlefields, and laboratories are not much different at all.

A conscientious event publicity ambassador.
She demonstrates a hundred and ten percent enthusiasm for her job. In fact, she almost signed up to compete herself.

A passionate sports commentator.
With so many different camera positions at our disposal and such diverse playing field conditions on offer, I bet you're dying to hear about every little detail? Well, you're in luck!

An outstanding yet solitary athlete.
Sometimes, just listening to those calls isn't enough for her.

A slightly nervous racer.
She has heard countless stories about broken noses, teeth, and bones. Obviously, this is not the best way to prepare for a face-off.

An earnest group stage competitor.
This girl scout never backs down from a challenge, but that doesn't mean she never gets nervous.

A confident group stage competitor.
She basically taught the entire group how to engage in simple everyday conversations in Hawaiian, effectively lowering everyone's stress levels.

A sedate group stage competitor.
To her, racing and hunting are essentially the same: identify your target, never hesitate, and never give up.

A peculiar-looking competitor.
Hey, buddy ... You and your car aren't gonna start shedding parts, right?

A peculiar-looking competitor.
This weird thing in my hand? It's just a plain old maintenance tool, of course.

A semi-finalist who excels at planning.
She has familiarized herself with the route and made the optimal arrangements for every turn and stop along the way.

A semi-finalist who flies as free as the wind. Plans have never been his style.
On the contrary, he is one with his vehicle, and the two of them improvise in unison.

A calm and focused semi-finalist.
There is something she has never told anyone—whenever she holds the steering wheel, certain memories flood into her heart.

An overwhelmingly ambitious finalist.
Whatever track he's racing on, rain or shine, arcanum or ordinary vehicles, the only thing that matters to him is speed.

A finalist with a wealth of experience.
Consecutive corners? Long-distance driving? Burst tires? Listening to him tell his many tales takes about the same time as a rally.

A perpetually excited finalist.
Though he tried the flying, beast taming, and incantation dueling events, he ultimately fell in love with these steel beasts at first sight, and hopes they'll never be apart.
Through his many years of self-cultivation, he has hidden well his true power, choosing to gradually seek enlightenment on the true essence of life and nature.
She always manages to find the best coping strategy in troubling times. In her own words, the higher the tide, the more likely it is to reach the summit.
People tend to see her as delicate and weak, but they're just more susceptible to being wounded by fragile objects and contracting infections such as tetanus.

Where does the story begin?
Little stones, red earth, distant fire.
Groping silhouettes, in the night sky, those who chase fire.
Hand in hand, heart touching heart,
surging deep in the throat, my warm fire.

Sharper than any blade, fiercer than any flame.
In the hall, in the shadows, in the busy daylight and the dark night.
In moments where no heads of the wicked need to be severed.
If you do not forsake justice, it will not forsake you.

Sails billow, swords shine, down the river.
A star twinkles in the north, chase it, chase it.
Conquer the seas, the lands, the ice rinks, and park reservoirs.
Your star twinkles in the north, Lagasa, Lagasa.

A critter that wanders from tavern to tavern stealing liquor.
As the most accomplished of the drunkards, being blacklisted from every tavern is only the first milestone on its path to infamy.

A critter that roams the taverns, discolored by years of drinking.
It preaches the virtues of moderation and generosity to his kin, especially when it has a full belly.

An eye-catching red-maned striped horse.
When words don't matter anymore, she's glad she can still rely on her swift hooves.

The tavern's nightmare, leaving no drop of liquor wherever it goes.
Except for the most exquisite drinks, nothing can awaken it from its drunken stupor.

A dutiful city gatekeeper.
A fine lock forged of copper and iron, impervious to flattery and bribery—only the wind can pass freely.

A dutiful city gatekeeper.
A stone lion with a fierce gaze, no one has ever seen him close his eyes, not even the sun.

A patrolman loyal to justice and the law.
The thief who picked locks and cracked chests is gone, and a patrolman more cunning than ever has emerged.

A patrolman loyal to justice and the law.
He tries his best to deny it, but he can't help but notice that some things smell better than the meals his wife and children cook.

The bailiff of Pei City, in charge of upholding the law.
To the common people, he is a symbol of fairness and justice. He carries only a sword in his hands, using it solely for matters of law and order.

The elusive feather man.
He's an expert on bones, birds, and the tree of longevity, but that's about all he knows.

One of the team's investigators.
He once had grand ambitions, scaling peaks and traversing valleys. But now, all he desires is the warmth and comfort of his own hearth.

One of the team's investigators.
He chased after hope, but all he found was disappointment. They say he's indecisive, and that's exactly what people need him to be.

Wooden dolls that frequent the tavern and persuade patrons to drink.
Loyal servants of alcohol, they are gentle and well-meaning, always understanding that your icy heart needs the warmth of the drink.

A wooden figure that frequents the tavern, persuading patrons to drink a stronger variety of alcohol.
His cups, filled with the heart and soul of alcohol, are as hard to resist as a raging bull, causing even the most seasoned drinker to run away.

A creation resembling a mythical beast.
Through countless years, in the glow of firelight and cooking smoke, they finally caught the spark and built its temple.

A creation resembling a mythical beast.
For countless years, the beasts dwelling among the peaks and rain have been blessed with grace, and have in turn nurtured its domain.

A typical horse with striped markings.
Now, without the need for argument or shyness, a rope has once again replaced its will.

A malevolent observer, an uninvited guest.
It seems more like a toy than an experiment. It offers no opportunity for friendly communication.

A strangely shaped man-made device, seemingly transmitting some signal.
It is very impolite to interfere with someone else's communication, but if you insist, it can fully file a suit with the interstellar law enforcement agency.

A crawling Critter, a giant eyeless spider.
The web it weaves is as white as snow. It's a shame that no one survives to witness the intricate craftsmanship.

A monster that roams through caves and soil horizons, emitting a foul stench.
Ranked 32nd on the "Critters You Don't Want to Encounter List," it is described as "unpredictable, and even if you escape or beat it, it's hard to wash its lingering smell off your clothes."
A little Critter that loves the cold—the most fashionable of its tribe! It meticulously maintains its metallic skin and moss flowers, and now all Critters envy its shiny casquette.

A group of Critters adapted to cold climates.
Certain Critters are quite fond of their white coloring, and to avoid shedding in the summer, they often migrate to higher altitudes.

An enthusiastic and generous little Critter.
By the road, wait—hat! By the road, chase—hat! Catch the hat! New hat! Go! Go!

A running Critter, some strange kind of entangled wolf duo.
Sometimes they bite each other. Sometimes the nights are too cold, and they huddle together.

A spark left behind by refugees at their temporary camp.
It represents that your direction is true, but before continuing your pursuit, it's best that you extinguish it first.

The spirit of a traveler who perished wandering near a snow mountain.
He waits for a passerby willing to accompany him—to find his camera roll filled with the beautiful scenery by his bones.

The spirit of a traveler who perished wandering near a snow mountain.
She doesn't like people laughing when they see her, nor does she like people screaming when they see her. She hides in the snow, instead becoming a praised and beautiful little snowflake.

A homeless arcanist, a member of the refugee group.
She no longer has any hope for her compatriots; instead, she'd rather have some friends who can't talk, or even make her friends unable to talk.

A girl with four hooves. A member of one of the deer girl tribes.
With her slender fingers, she tears tendons, with her slender fingers, she weaves garlands. Her clipping-clopping hoofbeats are ever cheerful, she is so at ease.

A giant Critter living in high-altitude areas.
Sensitive hearing and severe morning grumpiness combine to unleash this frequently insomniac abomination.

The lord of the Critters who loves the cold.
He's keen on making patterns in meadows and snowfields with his wheels—for this, he has collected dozens of kinds of "brushes."

A non-naturally formed wildfire, yet to spread.
Fed by human resentment, its energy source is mixed, not only relying on material combustion.

An exiled arcanist, a member of the refugees.
The flame keeps her from the cold, but not from hunger. With anger as a seasoning, she is willing to devour all living things before her.

Unafraid of the cold, perennially covered in snow.
She brings a warm blessing where she goes, its recipients always ecstatic, they dance fervently until their limbs stiffen.

A group of Critters who live for adventure.
With storm jackets, signposts, and weathervanes, they are ready to go and are always excited. Where did they get these things? Oh... that's not important!

A faithful follower of Manus Vindictae.
Nurtured by her loving care, within the confines of a skull, her blooms are truly mesmerizing.

A product of Manus Vindictae, devoid of any soul.
It has transcended the need for a vessel and is no longer bound by thought. This is the epitome of the mind's perfection.

An unlabeled storage bag, it's hard to say what's inside.
Little tin soldiers, old glasses, or...? Anyway, it shouldn't be moving, should it?

Perhaps this is the owner of the wooden pushcart and those tools.
She is full of sorrow and anger, but there's also an unexpected panic about her.

An arcanist wandering the land. A member of the refugees.
When she awakens, her only purpose is revenge, on everyone. This sweet taste makes her sleep better than any bedtime story.

A group of Critters with a mania for collecting gold.
Dust? Dust! Crunch, crunch, hard! Crunch, crunch, crunch, delicious!

An old control device, the key to operating old machinery.
One round and another. The next sixty rounds are no different from the previous ones. The gears creak, turning like this for so many years.

The incarnation of a nightmare sprite, with the ability to bewilder and transform.
What people fear is also what they consider to be most powerful and invincible, and so it is for the nightmare fairy—a creature that was once a warhorse. For a hundred years, this fairy has insisted on presenting itself as a knight.

An arcanist among the refugees seeking answers.
A pie is shared by everyone, so the portions are not big enough to satisfy anyone's hunger. So, if this suffering is shared by everyone, will her pain also be lessened?
A small clenched fist holds tight the things most cherished in her heart.

A faithful disciple of Manus Vindictae.
She exudes emotion, tenderness, and empathy, and guides the way for those confined by constraints.

A creation of Manus Vindictae, devoid of any soul.
It has forsaken its body and surrendered its thoughts to its sensations. This is truly the pinnacle of ecstasy.

An old mechanical device powered by its core.
It has now learned to conserve energy, drawing half its power from sunlight, nutrients and rain.

A statue born from the stubbornness of wood.
Allowing footsteps to inquire, the forest responds with silence.

This creature was formed from the discarded scales of Mothman, a harbinger of disaster.
It now resides in this desolate place, hoping to bring misfortune upon the dust and ruins. though it is a pity that no one has accepted this gift. Yet no one seems to welcome this dark gift.
A representation of a profound, lingering terror. At times, it can lift one end of a dream and then pour out malice from the other end, creating unsettling dreams.
Strong evidence of substantial harm to reality.
In one swift motion, it shatters the sense of rationality you hold so dearly.
At first glance, it may seem like a harmless decoration, just a lovely touch to enhance the dreamy atmosphere. But once you see its endless reflections, you'll realize its true nature.
A useful incantation. You can merge it with any <nobr>1-star</nobr> incantation to level up the latter.
A useful incantation. You can merge it with any <nobr>1-star</nobr> or <nobr>2-star</nobr> incantation to level up the latter.
Generates a special incantation that can merge and upgrade a rank 1 incantation.
Generates a special incantation that can merge and upgrade a rank 1/2 incantation.
Retains the ranks of all current incantations and randomly changes them into new ones.
Can move an Arcane Incantation once for free. This movement does not generate Moxie.

Green mountains, willows, and moonlight.
Fragrant wine in poetry and beyond.
The sky within the city and the sky beyond.
Each word and stroke, what is known and what is still unknown.
Observe and learn, the world is like a cloudy wine, its taste only discovered through trying.

Watching, always watching. Five hundred years for spring, five hundred years for autumn.
Under the shade of the trees, there is nothing new.
In bones, in jade, in stories read countless times,
Yet the puzzle remains, still existing.

Coffee, cocoa, or perhaps "dark matter coffee." The dark liquid swirls and swirls. 
On the far side or this side of the universe. 
Tasteless, acidic, completely chilled, not recommended for consumption by any life form. 
Not much different from working on official business.

Poetry is here, says the poet. 
Winter is here, says the sparrow. 
With the tip of a pen, the claw of a foot, with the soul or the silence of knowing everything. 
Write poetry on the blank earth.

Fleeting shadows and ephemeral memories, countless silhouettes become the smallest units of the heart, forming emotions, experiences, and perspectives. Observing the heart's images is to record groups of silhouettes.
Used for imprinting the psyche, providing minute experiences.

{Summon Rules}

<color=#B65223>[▩1%s]</color> time-limited summoning event has begun. During the event, 6-star characters <color=#B65223>[upname=1]</color> and <color=#B65223>[upname=2]</color> enjoy rate up!

<color=#B65223>[▩1%s]</color> is a <color=#B65223>[Time-Limited Event Banner]</color> and does NOT share guarantee count with other similar banners.

This is a <color=#B65223>[▩1%s]</color> banner. The guarantee count is calculated independently and is NOT shared with other similar banners.

After the event, the guarantee count of <color=#B65223>[▩1%s]</color> will be cleared and will NOT carry over to other similar banners.

▪  In this event, each of the first three "Summon x10" attempts consumes Unilog x8 only.
▪  Every 10 summons guarantees at least one 4-star or higher character.
▪  Generally, the basic rate applies to all characters. Under certain circumstances, such as Rate Up or Guarantee, please refer to the specific rules.

{Summon Rates}

In banner <color=#B65223>[▩1%s]</color>:
Basic rate of summoning 6-star characters: 1.5%. Overall rate (including Guarantee): 2.36%;
Basic rate of summoning 5-star characters: 8.5%;
Basic rate of summoning 4-star characters: 40%;
Basic rate of summoning 3-star characters: 45%;
Basic rate of summoning 2-star characters: 5%.

For 6-star summons, there's a 70% chance to get one of the rate-up characters, with both having equal chances. If the summoned 6-star is not one of the rate-up characters, the next 6-star summon will guarantee a rate-up character.

For 5-star summons, all characters have equal rates.

{Special Rules}

In banner <color=#B65223>[▩1%s]</color>, if you have not obtained any 6-star character after 60 consecutive summons, the rate of summoning a 6-star character in the next summon will rise from 1.5% to 4%. If you still have not obtained any 6-star character, then every next summon that doesn't grant a 6-star character will increase the rate by 2.5%.

Every 70 summons guarantees 1 6-star character.

P.S. After you have obtained a 6-star character, the rate of summoning 6-star characters in <color=#B65223>[▩1%s]</color> type events will be reset to 1.5%.

{Duplicate Characters}

Regardless of source, including but not limited to banners, Bank, and system gifts:

▪  When you obtain the same 6-star character for the 2nd–6th time, the duplicate character will be converted into <color=#B65223>1</color> Artifice of the character and <color=#B65223>12</color> Albums of the Lost every time; starting from the 7th time, the duplicate character will be converted into <color=#B65223>28</color> Albums of the Lost every time.

▪  When you obtain the same 5-star character for the 2nd–6th time, the duplicate character will be converted into <color=#B65223>1</color> Artifice of the character and <color=#B65223>3</color> Albums of the Lost every time; starting from the 7th time, the duplicate character will be converted into <color=#B65223>7</color> Albums of the Lost every time.

▪  When you obtain the same 4-star character for the 2nd–6th time, the duplicate character will be converted into <color=#B65223>1</color> Artifice of the character and <color=#B65223>8</color> Tracks of the Lost every time; starting from the 7th time, the duplicate character will be converted into <color=#B65223>12</color> Tracks of the Lost every time.

▪  When you obtain the same 3-star character for the 2nd–6th time, the duplicate character will be converted into <color=#B65223>1</color> Artifice of the character and <color=#B65223>4</color> Tracks of the Lost every time; starting from the 7th time, the duplicate character will be converted into <color=#B65223>7</color> Tracks of the Lost every time.

▪  When you obtain the same 2-star character for the 2nd–6th time, the duplicate character will be converted into <color=#B65223>1</color> Artifice of the character and <color=#B65223>3</color> Tracks of the Lost every time; starting from the 7th time, the duplicate character will be converted into <color=#B65223>5</color> Tracks of the Lost every time.
